name: Improve 2.87 → 2.5 Bound
description: Haxell 1999 proved τ ≤ (66/23)ν ≈ 2.87ν. No improvement in 26 years. Goal: prove τ ≤ 2.5ν or better.

known_techniques.limitation: Gives 3ν easily, 2.87 with work, stuck below

why_stuck.observation: 26 years with no improvement suggests either: (1) 2.87 is tight for current techniques, or (2) fundamentally new approach needed
why_stuck.fractional_gap: τ* ≤ 2ν is tight. Integral gap between τ and τ* is mystery.

connection_to_our_lemmas.structural_decomposition: Our Parker lemmas give inductive structure
connection_to_our_lemmas.key_gap: Need to bound integrality gap τ/τ*

approach_1.name: Integrality gap analysis
approach_1.idea: Prove τ ≤ c·τ* for some c < 1.435

approach_2.name: Structural induction extension
approach_2.idea: Extend Parker's ν≤3 technique to general graphs

approach_3.name: Local improvement
approach_3.idea: Haxell uses c=66/23. Find tighter local ratio

risk_assessment: HIGH RISK. 26 years of no progress suggests this is very hard. But: our 30 lemmas give computational scaffolding not available before.
why_attempt_anyway: Aristotle's strength is finding unexpected connections. Our lemma library is unprecedented scaffolding.
